author: manunlp
content:
<@785811170387951616> <@931591385545584640> I get a lot of:

```
[2025-06-23 11:36:15.39] DEBUG p2p: Initiate peer disconnection agent=lodestar/v1.31.0 direction=Outbound error=p2p send: new stream: failed to negotiate protocol: protocols not supported: [/eth2/beacon_chain/req/status/2/ssz_snappy] multiaddr=/ip4/188.166.249.41/tcp/9000/p2p/16Uiu2HAkzy1oDMuNrcN3HuHf3hBa7yBk14Sigjmrqafj52CJsjv8 remainingActivePeers=38
``` 
(Lodestar)

```
[2025-06-23 11:36:16.99] DEBUG p2p: Initiate peer disconnection agent=nimbus direction=Outbound error=p2p send: new stream: failed to negotiate protocol: protocols not supported: [/eth2/beacon_chain/req/status/2/ssz_snappy] multiaddr=/ip4/170.64.169.241/tcp/9000/p2p/16Uiu2HAmFjdVmMY6c7qx7TKSrMdjZeyqtvcqM9QCFKvxmHDm3kBd remainingActivePeers=39
```
(Nimbus)

Is it expected?

author: manunlp
content: (For information Prysm says it disconnects, but actually it does not, for devnet purposes. We plan to re really disconnect in such a case soon.)

author: matthewkeil
content: Or pr will get merged today for StatusV2 support

author: potuz
content: Do we have tests for very long reorgs on EIP 7917?

author: jtraglia
content: There aren't any new reorg spec tests specific to EIP-7917. Should there be?

author: jtraglia
content: What would you consider to be a long reorg? I'm not sure we have any "long" reorg tests.

author: jtraglia
content: Also, maybe this would be better suited outside of the spec tests.

author: potuz
content: just trigger a 64 block reorg that completely changes the shuffling and check that clients do work well. I think there are Forkchoice tests regarding this though

author: jtraglia
content: If there are existing tests for this, it should be run automatically for Fulu.

author: nc1234
content: Did anyone test against the test cases here for fork digest? https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/29a3e565d5d51820a10621190d8711afb98c3e30/tests/core/pyspec/eth2spec/test/fulu/validator/test_compute_fork_digest.py My understanding is pre-fulu (epoch < 100) we don't mix in blob parameters into digest calculation, but the test cases in the spec test seem to be doing so. cc <@592004585506340885>

author: jtraglia
content: Ugh, you're right, that's very misleading. This test will always use `fulu.compute_fork_digest`. I think you can simply ignore `ELECTRA_FORK_EPOCH` and `FULU_FORK_EPOCH` in override. I'll make a PR to improve this tomorrow.

author: jtraglia
content: I think those were an artifact of the first way we tested this.
